The ngme2 Package

ngme2 is an R package used for fitting non-gaussian mixed effects models. These models are fitted using maximum likelihood estimation and preconditioned stochastic gradient descent.

Basic statistical operations such as likelihood evaluations and kriging predictions are also implemented.

Introduction

Several popular Gaussian random field models can be represented as solutions to stochastic partial differential equations (SPDEs) of the form LŒ≤(œÑu)‚ÄÑ=‚ÄÑùí≤. Here ùí≤ is a Gaussian white noise, L is a second-order differential operator, the fractional power Œ≤‚ÄÑ>‚ÄÑ0 determines the smoothness of u. See An explicit link between Gaussian fields and Gaussian Markov random fields: the stochastic partial differential equation approach for further details.

This package aims to address the non-Gaussian extension to the SPDE approach model by replacing the driven noise ùí≤ to be a non-Gaussian noise ‚Ñ≥. More specificly, a type-G L√©vy process.

The increment of a type-G L√©vy process can be represented as $$ \gamma + \mu V + \sigma \sqrt{V}Z, $$ where Œ≥,‚ÄÜŒº are parameters, Z‚ÄÑ‚àº‚ÄÑN(0,1) and is independent of V, and V is a positive infinitely divisible random variable.

One example is the normal inverse Gaussian (NIG) noise. (See vignette("SPDE-approach", package = "ngme2") for more details)

Installation instructions

The development version can be installed using the command

remotes::install_github("davidbolin/ngme2", ref = "devel")

See also the Installation and Configuration vignette.
